title: You can still make item sets manually
body:
You can find already existing item sets in Riot Games/League Of Legends/config/champions and inside the relevant champion recommended folder.

For naming, I'm using the style the original one used which is RIOT_ItemSet_#.json << MAKE SURE IT'S JSON

Here's an example:
{"mode":"any","associatedChampions":[],"type":"custom","sortrank":4999,"uid":"INSERTYOURIDHERE","champion":"Teemo","associatedMaps":[],"priority":true,"blocks":[{"type":"starting","items":[{"id":"1055","count":1},{"id":"2003","count":1}]},{"type":"Core","items":[{"id":"3151","count":1},{"id":"3085","count":1},{"id":"3146","count":1},{"id":"3115","count":1},{"id":"3089","count":1}]},{"type":"???","items":[{"id":"3157","count":1},{"id":"3089","count":1},{"id":"3285","count":1},{"id":"3116","count":1},{"id":"3145","count":1}]}],"isGlobalForMaps":true,"title":"Teemo","map":"any","isGlobalForChampions":false}

A few things to note: I don't know how to get uid. If someone else knows, I'd greatly appreciate it. The example one in mine is: LOL_E2EF002B-B1FE-E103-A7F1-811267F7F230. I only know this because I had an old item set sitting there which I could look at. Though I imagine if you're interested in this you already have old item sets. 

Mode and type I'd recommend just keep as is. AssociatedChampions I'd also keep as is. Champion changes according to what champion the set is for. I'd keep associatedMaps empty because I don't know what can go in there. Priority means it's set as the item set when you first open the shop I believe, can be true or false. Blocks beings to define what different rows are in the item sets and MUST start with a [ and end with ]. When first defining a new block being with { and end with }. "type" is the name of the block, so "type":"starting" names it as starting. "items" means that the following section is the items within the block. That must also have a [ and { at the start and } ] to end it. "ID" is the item in question whereas count is for potions and whatnot. http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/tool/ is where you can find item ID's. 

Hope this helps anyone who wants to make items sets, I apologize if I explained poorly.
